title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
fullTitle: Monty Python and the Holy Grail (1975)

items.author: Gregory Weinkauf
items.content: What we have here is an historical document of inestimable value, describing in no uncertain terms the terrible and beautiful times before AIDS.

items.author: Michael Sragow
items.content: It's still the Holy Grail of crazy comedy.

items.author: Jay Carr
items.content: Nobody ever placed brilliance in the service of silliness quite the way the Python gang did. Monty Python and the Holy Grail is stuffed with both.

items.author: Peter Bradshaw
items.content: The material is superb, Neil Innes’ music is tremendous and Gilliam’s animations are timelessly brilliant.

items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: An incredibly silly film of great humor, brilliant design and epic insanity.

items.author: Kevin Thomas
items.content: Has a sense of humor that is intellectual, even academic, at heart.
Silly, sophomoric, and slapped together, but would you want it any other way?

items.author: Steven Rea
items.content: Still stands as a gloriously silly and twisted send-up.
Basically an excuse for set pieces, some amusing, others overdone.
